main event: A star-shaped object was observed visually by an aircraft in the Atlantic on December 16, 1961.
interesting points: The object was bright with a magnitude similar to a 1st magnitude star., The observation lasted for 3 minutes and was made from an aircraft without optical aids., The object was first spotted at 15 degrees elevation., The object's direction and speed were not confirmed., The reporting officer initially believed it to be a satellite.
